description: two prints on one sheet of paper; on the left is the face and neck of a man with eyes closed and a halo around his head; there is a small circle in the lower right corner; eyelids, area under eyes, and circle colored with brown ink; on the right two figures in center of image with their heads close together; the figure on the left has his hand raised with his thumb extended; at the bottom of the image is the profile of a smaller head looking up at the other figures; smaller head in the foreground and the background colored in blue-green ink; a small circle in the upper right of the image is colored in brownish ink
inscription: UL margin of sheet, in pencil: Bibeldruck. Im I. Mose 37. (Hadern-Verlag.) | LL of sheet below first image, in pencil: Probedruck. / E. 4 48/1 E.170 F | BC of sheet below second image, in pencil: Probedruck. / E.171 F | LRC of sheet, in pencil: [illegible] mee-- | LLC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 1820 | BC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 1819
signed: LR in pencil, below both images: Walter Gramatté / 23 / S3
title: Joseph is sold out of envy by his brothers. Plate 1, "Look, there comes the dreamer" (left); Plate II, "Let's throw him into a pit" (right)
